_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The seventy-seven grounds for knowledge: The knowledge that rebirth is a condition for old age and death, and the knowledge that when rebirth doesn’t exist, there is no old age and death.
The knowledge that continued existence is a condition for rebirth.
The knowledge that ignorance is a condition for choices, and the knowledge that when ignorance doesn’t exist, there are no choices.
Their knowledge that even this knowledge of the stability of natural principles is liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.
